content: wavy trinket tray crochet pattern by valmakesthings looking for a quick and quirky project this wavy trinket tray is the perfect blend of function and fun whether you re corralling jewelry keys or crafty odds and ends this playful little catch-all brings a pop of personality to any space grab your hook pick your favorite yarn and let s ride the wave note that this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only this pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way gauge & size not critical for this project the pattern was designed using cotton worsted weight yarn and a 5mm hook this hook-yarn combo made a trinket tray approximately 16cm long and 6cm wide materials -5mm hook -20m worsted weight yarn suggested yarn loops & threads classic cotton -stitch marker abbreviations -chain chain -double_crochet double_crochet -decrease double_crochet 2 together decrease 1 -single_crochet single_crochet -single_crochet-blo single_crochet through back loop only pattern this trinket tray is worked flat for the first two row and then worked in the round in a continuous spiral you ll find the stitch counts for each row/round at the end of the row/round instructions shown in round brackets like this 20 foundation chain chain 26 26 row 1 double_crochet in the fourth chain from your hook double_crochet in the next 5 chs 2 double_crochet in the next 2 chs double_crochet in the next 5 chs decrease decrease double_crochet in the next 5 chs 2 double_crochet in the next 2 chs turn 24 row 2 chain 3 counts as a double_crochet stitch double_crochet in the next 6 stitches decrease decrease double_crochet in the next 5 stitches 2 double_crochet in the next 2 stitches double_crochet in the next 5 stitches decrease 24 do not turn do not make any chs mark the last stitch you just worked in row 2 with a stitch marker you will now start working in continuous rounds continuing to work in the same direction you just worked for row 2 and using the stitch marker to keep track of the rounds round 1 work 1 single_crochet in each stitch around the perimeter border of the 2-row wave piece you ve just made starting with the short edge immediately next to the last stitch you just worked in row 2 where you placed your stitch marker when working the short edge you will be working into the side of double_crochet stitches for each short edge work 3 single_crochet spread evenly across the short edge 54 24 for each long edge 3 for each short edge round 2 single_crochet-blo all stitches working into the back loop only creates the edge between the base of the tray and its edges/walls 54 round 3 single_crochet all stitches fasten_off and weave in ends 54 this completes your wavy trinket tray enjoy
